item.title: Introduction to Node Crawler Series
item.description: This is a set of tutorials that will help you with your very first crawler with node.js. The plan of this tutorial is as follows. First of all, we will write a functional crawler using node.js and dump the data into files or simply print it on screen. In the following article, we will use MongoDB as our data management system and organize our data. Then we will optimize and attack some of the pitfalls.

item.title: Basics of Redis
item.description: Basics Redis is: NoSQL KeyValue In memory Data Structure Server binary safe strings lists, sets, sorted sets, hashes bitmaps, hyperloglogs Open source Redis is: Fast Low CPU Requirement Scalable Redis can be used as: Cache Analytics Leaderboard Queues Cookie storage Expiring data Messaging High I/O workloads API throttlings How to persist your data Snapshot AOF: Append Only File Pros:
